Utmost tranquility
bathes the serene expression of the indolent senior
who never goes to class and has just won seventeen

Harriers Close Season Of
Dual Meets By 15-40
Win Over Dickinson
Completing their regular season
in a blaze of glory, the Johns Hopkins harriers routed Dickinson last
Saturday by the score of 15-40. Five
Hopkins runners crossed the ilne
together in first place, covering the
four and one-quarter mile course in
the time of 23.46. As only the first
five men to finish on each team are
counted in the final point total, the
Blue Jays won by the largest score
possible.
King, Holtzman, and Sholtes of
Hopkins took the lead immediately
at the start of the race, with Captain
Lewis and Emmert only several
yards behind. These five men rapidly outdistanced all the opposing
harriers, and jogged in about 75
yards ahead of their closest competitor, Brown, also of Hopkins.
Kirkman, the remaining Blue Jay
runner, finished in ninth position.

Harriers Close Season Of
Dual Meets By 15-40
Win Over Dickinson
Completing their regular season
in a blaze of glory, the Johns Hopkins harriers routed Dickinson last
Saturday by the score of 15-40. Five
Hopkins runners crossed the ilne
together in first place, covering the
four and one-quarter mile course in
the time of 23.46. As only the first
five men to finish on each team are
counted in the final point total, the
Blue Jays won by the largest score
possible.
King, Holtzman, and Sholtes of
Hopkins took the lead immediately
at the start of the race, with Captain
Lewis and Emmert only several
yards behind. These five men rapidly outdistanced all the opposing
harriers, and jogged in about 75
yards ahead of their closest competitor, Brown, also of Hopkins.
Kirkman, the remaining Blue Jay
runner, finished in ninth position.
